title: Personal Data Visualization
text:
This code displayed visualizes the time I spend on school work each day of the week. I created a plot where the day of week is on the x-axis and time spent on homework is non the y-axis. The jittered points represent individually time spent each day. The red points represent the mean time each day spent on school work


Code
mydata$day.of.week <- factor(mydata$day.of.week,
                             levels = c("Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday",
                                        "Thursday", "Friday", "Saturday",
                                        "Sunday")) 

mean_data <- mydata |>
  group_by(day.of.week) |>
  summarize(mean_time = mean(Time.spent.on.Schoolwork.min.))

ggplot(mydata,
       aes(x = day.of.week,
           y = Time.spent.on.Schoolwork.min.,
           color = day.of.week)) +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.1,
              height = 0,
              alpha = 0.5) +
  geom_point(data = mean_data, aes(y = mean_time), shape = 16, size = 3, color = "red") +
  scale_color_manual(values = c(
    "Monday" = "magenta",
    "Tuesday" = "orange",
    "Wednesday" = "gold",
    "Thursday" = "green",
    "Friday" = "darkblue",
    "Saturday" = "black",
    "Sunday" = "turquoise"
  )) +
  labs(
    title = "Average Time Spent on School Work by Day of Week",
    x = "Day of the Week",
    color = "Day of Week",
    y = "Time Spent on School Work (min)"
  )

title: Personal Data Visualization
text:
This code displayed visualizes the time I spend on school work each day of the week. I created a plot where the day of week is on the x-axis and time spent on homework is non the y-axis. The jittered points represent individually time spent each day. The red points represent the mean time each day spent on school work


Code
mydata$day.of.week <- factor(mydata$day.of.week,
                             levels = c("Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday",
                                        "Thursday", "Friday", "Saturday",
                                        "Sunday")) 

mean_data <- mydata |>
  group_by(day.of.week) |>
  summarize(mean_time = mean(Time.spent.on.Schoolwork.min.))

ggplot(mydata,
       aes(x = day.of.week,
           y = Time.spent.on.Schoolwork.min.,
           color = day.of.week)) +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.1,
              height = 0,
              alpha = 0.5) +
  geom_point(data = mean_data, aes(y = mean_time), shape = 16, size = 3, color = "red") +
  scale_color_manual(values = c(
    "Monday" = "magenta",
    "Tuesday" = "orange",
    "Wednesday" = "gold",
    "Thursday" = "green",
    "Friday" = "darkblue",
    "Saturday" = "black",
    "Sunday" = "turquoise"
  )) +
  labs(
    title = "Average Time Spent on School Work by Day of Week",
    x = "Day of the Week",
    color = "Day of Week",
    y = "Time Spent on School Work (min)"
  )

title: Favorite Courses
text: One of my favorite courses taken at UCSB is Earth Science 2. It was my first exposure to geology and learned a lot about the different earth processes and plate tectonics. I enjoyed going on a one day field trip to the Santa Ynez mountains and observing the different processes.

title: About Me
text:
Background
I grew up in Santa Barbara, California. I enjoy spending time by the beach and love the weather here. I am currently pursuing a bachelors degree in Hydrologic Sciences and Policy and plan to pursue a career focused on substantially and environmental protection.

title: About Me
text:
Photography
I enjoy photography in my free time. I enjoy taking pictures of places I have been or anything that I can capture in the moment. Here are some photos I have taken over the years.

title: About Me
text:
Baking
I have recently been enjoying baking different kinds of desserts and pastries from all around the world. I enjoy learning the different recipes and cultures behind them. One of my favorites was baking baklava at home which took a lot of time but was very worth it in the end.

title: Sara Guefroudj
text:
Hello my name is Sara Guefroudj. I am a student at the University of California Santa Barbara. I am a third year Hydrologic Science and Policy major.
```

title: Critical Thinking Project
text:
For my Environmental science 40 critical thinking course taken at UCSB, I chose to do a research essay on the effects of lithium mining. One of the main goals for this project was to be able to use and demonstrate critical thinking skills. Throughout the 10 week course I was able to learn different kinds of evidence, methods, and arguments to produce a research essay.

<a href="research_essay.pdf">Download PDF</a>.
